title: Call me racist call me rude but...
body:
...next time I get someone in my team who is only speaking in Chinese/Korean/Japanese/etc I'm going to report them for refusing to communicate with a note pointing out to Riot what server they should be on.

If they actually live in Australia/New Zealand they can make the effort to learn basic English.

Quoted from LoL wiki

> Players can also switch their language preference, in the following servers:
> 
> Brazil: Only Portuguese
> EU Nordic & East: English, Polish, Romanian and Greek
> EU West: English, German, Spanish, French and Italian
> Latin America North: Only Spanish
> Latin America South: Only Spanish
> North America: Only English
> Oceania: Only English
> Russia: Only Russian
> Turkey: Only Turkish

If the client for a region doesn't support the language you speak, you either need to learn the basics of the language(s) that it DOES support, or find a server that supports your native language. Riot and the likes of Garena do their best to make severs locally available to players in as much of the world as possible.

If you live in New Zealand or Australia and you know enough basic English to get by in a game of LoL USE IT. It's just rude to never ping and then start talking in a non-supported language.

At least use pinyin or its equivalent so that it's not just a mass of foreign characters.

replies.body:
While I agree that, since most people on the server speak english, people playing on the server should learn enough basic english for the purpose of champion select and be able to use pings effectively in-game, reporting someone for "refusing to communicate" doesn't cover "language barriers" as stated on the "Reporting a Player" page of the support section of the website, and I quote, "**Refusing to Communicate with Team** - This applies to any Summoner that refuses to use chat or pings. *Please note that this is **not** meant to be used in cases of language barrier!*"
Source: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player

Meh English speakers who are living in other regions don't go around learning the native's language most of the time anyway.

But they all want others to learn English.

For the most part, the reason why they would wanna type in their first language is generally associating with them playing together with buddies. A better communication between 2+ people, using the language they're familiar with, is definitely better than communicating with everyone through a subpar display of second language that may end up with nobody understanding anything.

If they're using pings correctly I fail to see why you would wanna report them for refuse to communicate, it's not like the chat box is something that is ever used by anyone to enhance the strategic significance in solo queue anyway, at least generally.

EDIT: I do agree that if someone is playing all the way from across the sea for whatever reason, it's really better for them to just stick with their own server, or at least the one that is closest to them.

>Meh English speakers who are living in other regions don't go around learning the native's language most of the time anyway.

But very few places don't have people that speak English.

Also saying all English speakers don't is actually racist.

Fact is if we all spoke 1 language it would be easier.

The reason why not many people don't at least have a basic comprehension of English (not just Aus, globally) is not because everyone wants to, but forced to due to economical pressures. Which I wouldn't say it's fair in the end of the day, making that statement sounding a little "backwards" for me if you get what I mean but I digress.

Yeah it certainly would be easier if everyone speaks the same language, I blame Babylon.
Even when I was on NA (this was before the Latin America server was a real thing) I made sure I knew some basic Spanish because I knew who the server catered for.

BUT NOTHING! That is in fact racist and rude. OCE is multicultural and saying BS like this just highlights your ignorance and intolerance to other cultures and languages within OCE. This diversity of cultures make OCE what it is, you should accept this. 

Tell me, what server should a non english speaking Maori from NZ play on? What about a non english speaking indigenous Australian? Hmmmm? What about someone from papua. Where should they play? 

The game has communication tools such as pings to communicate, so use them. FFS if they are playing well, using pings and if they aren't AFK or feeding you should be happy. Some players don't talk at all, do you report them for 'refusing to communicate? They were communicating, you were just frustrated that you couldn't understand them. 

You should be the one making the effort mate, to accept others and their cultures within the OCE. If you cant understand them, use your pings instead, have a concrete cuppa and harden up buddy.
